dtliExcerpt: As in 2018’s unfortunate King Kong, the colossal title character of Redwood (which Jesse christens Stella) is the best thing about this musical, even though—or maybe because—it doesn’t sing. But arboreal splendor can’t compensate for the blandness that surrounds it. The show is all bark and no bite.

keyPhrases.quote: arboreal splendor can't compensate for the blandness that surrounds it
The show is all bark and no bite
the colossal title character...is the best thing about this musical

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite praising the titular tree character and production design, the critic clearly pans the show with pointed criticism about 'blandness' and the dismissive pun 'all bark and no bite' that signals fundamental dissatisfaction. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong disappointment in the overall quality of the musical, indicating it fails to engage despite a notable visual element.
